main event: On 16th March 1950, at Pacific Beach, Washington, an unknown aerial object was observed for 4 minutes, exhibiting deceleration to a comparatively slow speed and making a series of incalculable movements.
interesting points: The object was first sighted at 0732 GMT on 15th March 1950 at 360 degrees true from Pacific Beach, Washington.
It changed its bearing to 270 degrees and descended from 15 degrees on the horizon.
The object exhibited a deceleration to a comparatively slow speed and began a series of incalculable movements while maintaining its relative position.
There were no sketches, photographs, sound, or exhaust trail observed, and no color was reported.
The report was part of the Project Blue Book, a US Air Force investigation into unidentified flying objects (UFOs).
